definition: Wuhou district of Chengdu city 成都市[Cheng2 du1 shi4], Sichuan
martial/military
surname Wu
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
surname Hou
memorial hall to Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮 (many of them in different town)/refers to tourist attraction in Chengdu 成都
Wuhou district of Chengdu city 成都市[Cheng2 du1 shi4], Sichuan

sentences.english: The marquis's eye became round because he had a mania for horse.
sentences.chinese: 武侯眼睛睜得更大了，因爲他是有名的馬癡。

sentences.english: Our company is located at the Wuhou Science Park in Chengdu with beautiful surroundings and convenient transportation.
sentences.chinese: 公司坐落在成都市武侯科技園，環境優美，交通便利。

sentences.english: And then went to the famous Temple.
sentences.chinese: 然後就去了大名鼎鼎的武侯祠。

sentences.english: This article is a record showing how the Temple of Marquis Wu remained intact in the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 本文記錄了武侯祠在這場災難中經受的考驗。

sentences.english: The Wuhou Temple park is actually quite large.
sentences.chinese: 在武侯祠公園實際上是相當大。

sentences.english: Leaving the bank we pass by the park around the Wuhou temple and Jingli Street.
sentences.chinese: 離開銀行後我們穿過武侯祠公園來到錦裏古街。

definition: Jiange county in Guangyuan 廣元|广元[Guang3 yuan2], Sichuan
Heavenly province (epithet of Sichuan, esp. area around Chengdu)/land of plenty
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
important general/generalissimo
imperial tutor

loyal and brave
Ma Chao (176-222), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
Xiling district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei
name of old state in modern Sichuan
Zitong county in Mianyang 綿陽|绵阳[Mian2 yang2], north Sichuan
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)

Yiling (barbarian mound), historical place name in Yichang county 宜昌縣|宜昌县 Hubei, first mentioned in history (after its destruction by Qin) as burial place of the former Chu kings/Yiling district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei
